IOS OSD Mooring Stations

This page hosts time series plots of temperature and salinity data from the Institute of Ocean Sciences (IOS) Ocean Sciences Division (OSD) mooring stations, located off the west coast of BC.

Mooring data from station E01.

Mooring data from station SCOTT2.

Mooring data from station A1.

Annual Data Availability

The following plots count how many measurements are available for each year of the data record. Separate plots are provided for each of temperature, salinity, and oxygen.

Monthly Data Availability

The following plots count how many measurements are available for each month of the data record. Separate plots are provided for each of temperature, salinity, and oxygen.

Instrument Depths

Plot showing the depths of CTDs and current meters on the mooring line for each deployment. Each point represents a CTD or current meter.

Raw Data

The data were binned into 10m bins centred on the standard instrument depths for each station to make these plots. Not all the available data fit into these bins. Data are separated by instrument (current meter or CTD) and variable (temperature or salinity).

Daily Mean Data

Filler

Daily Climatologies

Filler

Daily Mean Anomalies

Filler

Monthly Mean Data

Monthly mean data were computed from daily mean data.

Monthly Climatologies

Filler

Monthly Mean Anomalies

The monthly mean anomalies are the difference between the monthly mean values and the monthly climatological values.
